properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - FAIRLIGHT Sydney Rd at Woods Parade
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held at Fairlight Village on Saturday from 10am to 6pm

Changed traffic conditions will be in place with a westbound lane closure on Sydney Rd at Woods Pde and speed limit reduction to 40km/h through the area from 8am to 8pm.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 6am to 8pm on Hilltop Cres between Sydney Rd and Woods Pde (both sides) and Sydney Rd between Hilltop Cres and Woods Pde (western side).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - DEE WHY The Strand between Oaks Avenue AND Dee Why Parade
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held at Dee Why on Sunday from 10am to 6pm

The Strand will be closed between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde from 9pm Saturday 21 May until 8pm Sunday 22 May.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 6am to 8pm on The Strand between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde (western side).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: NRL - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Bulldogs at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 6pm and full time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Sea Eagles at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:55pm and full-time around 9:40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close ahead of full-time from 9.30pm for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Warriors at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 3pm and full-time approx. 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - HARRIS PARK Wigram Street between Ada Street AND Marion Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held at Harris Park on Saturday from 12pm to 8pm

Wigram St will be closed between Ada St and Marion St from 8am to midnight.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in effect from 6am to 10pm on both sides of Wigram St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: NRL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Panthers at the SCG. Kick off from 7:35pm and full-time around 9:35pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:35pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access the EP3 Southern grass car park (open from 4:35pm) or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling via the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 car park will not open for this game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)

  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.headline: Monster Truck Mania - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Monster Truck Maina at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday from 3pm until 5:45pm and Sunday from 1pm until 3:45pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: AFL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching GIANTS Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v West Coast Eagles at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce from 3:20pm, finishing approx. 5:50pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11.59pm the night before).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: FC Barcelona v A-League All Stars - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Tickets include return travel on public transport. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FC Barcelona v A-League All Stars at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Kick-off from 8.05pm, finishing around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as thousands of fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game from as early as 1am, see the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).
properties.displayName: FC Barcelona v A-League All Stars

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: Street Festival - CAMPSIE Beamish Street between Evaline Street AND South Parade
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Festival of Place event will be held on Beamish Street in Campsie on Saturday and Sunday from 11am to 8pm each day.

The following road closures will be in place from 8pm Friday 20 May until 5am Monday 23 May:

  • Beamish St between Evaline St and South Parade
  • Dewar St between Lillian St and Anzac Square
  • Anzac Square between Angelo Rd and Dewar St
  • Amy St between Amy Lane and Beamish St

Traffic can detour around Beamish St closures via Evaline St, Duke St and South Parade. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Street festival - FAIRFIELD Spencer Street at Ware Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Culinary Festival, held in the Fairfield City Centre on Saturday 28 May from 11am until late.

From 4am Saturday 28 May 2022, the following road closures are in place until midnight to accommodate the event:

  • Spencer St from Smart St to Ware St
  • Council Lane
  • Spencer Lane at Spencer St
  • Ware St from Kenyon St to Harris St

Motorists will be detoured via local roads and are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - COOGEE Coogee Bay Road between Arden Street AND Brook Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held on Coogee Bay Road in Coogee on Saturday from 10am to 6pm.

Coogee Bay Rd will be closed between Arden St and Brook St from 7am to 8pm.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in effect from 5am to 8pm on both sides of Coogee Bay Rd and on Vicar St between Coogee Bay Rd and 1 Vicar St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic control.

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - RANDWICK St Pauls Street between Perouse Road AND Nancye Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held on St Pauls St in Randwick on Sunday from 10am to 6pm.

St Pauls St will be closed between Perouse Rd and Nancye St from 8am to 8pm. A section of Nancye St will also be closed. Managed access for local traffic will be maintained.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in effect from 6am to 8pm on both sides of St Pauls St between Perouse Rd and Nancye St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic control on site.

properties.headline: Vivid Sydney - SYDNEY CBD, CIRCULAR QUAY, THE ROCKS, WALSH BAY, BARANGAROO George Street, Hickson Road, Pitt Street, Loftus Street
properties.publicTransport: On Friday to Sunday nights buses in Circular Quay will be relocated to stops at Martin Place. On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm Light rail services will not run between Town Hall and Circular Quay. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Monday to Thursdays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: VIVID 2022 Level 1 with insert Communications A3P v4.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Monday to Thursdays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Fridays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sundays and Monday 13 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sundays and Monday 13 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Saturdays and Sunday 12 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Saturdays and Sunday 12 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 12th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 27 May to Saturday 18 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect each night. 

Monday to Thursdays

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in The Rocks including George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St and Railway Colonnade at Central Station.
  • 7pm – midnight: northbound lanes of George St closed from Grosvenor St to Essex St.  

Fridays

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in The Rocks and Walsh Bay including George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Hickson Rd eastbound from Towns Place to Pottinger St and Railway Colonnade at Central Station.
  • 6pm – midnight: roads north of Bridge St at Circular Quay including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets.
  • 7pm – midnight: northbound lanes of George St from Grosvenor St to Essex St.  

Saturdays and Sunday (12 June) of the long weekend 

  • 5pm – 1am: closures in the Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks and Walsh Bay including sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St, Jamison St, Margaret St, Hunter St, George St north of King St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Hickson Rd eastbound from Towns Place to Pottinger St, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets at Circular Quay, and Railway Colonnade at Central Station. No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets on Saturday nights.

Sundays and Mon 13 June (public holiday)       

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in Circular Quay, The Rocks and Walsh Bay including George St north of Grosvenor St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Hickson Rd eastbound from Towns Place to Pottinger St, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets at Circular Quay, and Railway Colonnade at Central Station.

Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal will be closed each day during Vivid Sydney from 3pm until midnight (until 1am on Saturdays). Closures will also be in place on Wheat Rd and Darling Drive at Darling Harbour from 5.30pm to midnight on Friday-Sunday nights.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in effect on weekends.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Special event clearways - Monday to Thursdays

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Pitt Street, Loftus Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo

webLinks.linkText: Newcastle Entertainment Centre - Opals v Japan

properties.headline: International Basketball match - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Chatham Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Australian Opals v Japan at Newcastle Entertainment Centre. Game starts from 7.30pm and finishes around 9.30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as attendees travel to and from the Entertainment Centre. The right hand turn from Griffiths Rd into the Entertainment Centre may be restricted during the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Dubbo Regional Council - NRL game day info

properties.headline: NRL - DUBBO Cobra Street at Chelmsford Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Raiders at Apex Oval in Dubbo. Kick-off at 2pm and full time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Oval including the Mitchell Hwy, Wheelers Lane, Wingewarra St and Fitzroy St as crowds travel to the game.

Local roads around the stadium will close before kick off and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area. 

Drop off zones will be available on Wingewarra St and Chelmsford St nearby.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Vivid Sydney - DARLING HARBOUR Wheat Road, Darling Drive
properties.publicTransport: On Friday to Sunday nights buses in Circular Quay will be relocated to stops at Martin Place. On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm Light rail services will not run between Town Hall and Circular Quay. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Monday to Thursdays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: VIVID 2022 Level 1 with insert Communications A3P v4.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Monday to Thursdays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Fridays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Fridays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sundays and Monday 13 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sundays and Monday 13 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Saturdays and Sunday 12 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Saturdays and Sunday 12 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 12th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 27 May to Saturday 18 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect around Darling Harbour on Friday nights and weekends.  

Road closures on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and Monday 13 June - from 5.30pm to midnight:

  • Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour
  • Darling Dr between Ultimo Rd and Pier St roundabout

Roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks will also close each night from 5pm to midnight, and until 1am on Saturday nights. 

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on both sides of Wheat Rd from 4.30pm to midnight.

Clearways will also be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the CBD on weekends.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Concert - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Kid Laroi at Qudos Bank Arena on Thursday and Friday from 6pm until 10:30pm both nights.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

webLinks.linkText: Taronga Zoo - Vivid Sydney Wild Nights

properties.headline: Vivid Sydney Taronga Zoo - MOSMAN Bradleys Head Road at Taronga Zoo
properties.publicTransport: Ticketholders are encouraged to catch public transport as parking at the Zoo is very limited. Ferries and buses run regularly to Taronga Zoo from the city and north shore. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney’s iconic Tarong Zoo will light up during Vivid Sydney for two ticketed sessions at 5.30pm and 7.30pm on Wednesday to Sunday nights including public Holiday Monday. Pre-purchased event tickets are required.

No planned road closures or special event clearways will be in place around Taronga Zoo during Vivid however traffic will be heavy.

Motorists should expect delays on Military Rd, Spit Rd and Bradleys Head Rd as attendees travel to sessions starting at 5.30pm and 7.30pm.

Commuters are advised to allow additional travel time through Mosman during the evening peak on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday nights during Vivid.

properties.headline: NRL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v West Tigers at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm, full-time around 7:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are urged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race from 11:05am.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - PENRITH Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road at BlueBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Cowboys at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm and full-time approx. 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to and from the game.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Richmond Tigers at the SCG. First bounce from 7:50pm and full-time approx. 10:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, both open from 4:45pm. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: NRL - WOOLOOWARE Captain Cook Drive at PointsBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Roosters at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 7:35pm and full-time around 9:35pm. 

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and 30 minutes after full time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Super Rugby - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Blues at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 7:50pm, full time at approx. 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - BELMORE Edison Lane at Belmore Sports Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transport.info to play your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Dragons at Belmore Sports Ground. Kick off from 2pm, full time approx. 4pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Belmore Sports Ground as fans make their way to the game.

Parking is limited on local streets and car parks in the area. 

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Special event - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Open Training Session for Barcelona FC and A-League All Stars at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. A-League All Stars on field from 5:30pm until 6:30pm, and FC Baarcelona on field from 6:30pm until 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: Race Day - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. Start time from 12pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.headline: Street Festival - BURWOOD Burwood Road between Belmore Street AND Park Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting and using alternate stops while roads are closed.
properties.otherAdvice:
Burwood Autumn Fest on Saturday 21 May from 6pm to 10pm, and Sunday 22 May from 10am to 9:30pm.

Road closures will be in place from 3pm on Saturday 21 May until 10pm on Sunday 22 May on Burwood Rd between Belmore St and Park Ave. 

Sections of Clarendon Pl, Deane St and Victoria St E will also be closed. 

Motorists travelling northbound can detour around the closures via Belmore St, Conder St, Railway Pde, Shaftsbury Rd and Wilga St to return to Burwood Rd. Motorists travelling southbound can detour around the closures via Wilga St, Shaftesbury Rd and Railway Pde, or Belmore St to return to Burwood Rd.

A reduced speed limit of 40km/h will also be in place on road approaching the event. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic control on site.

webLinks.linkText: Event website - Festival of the Fleeces

properties.headline: Community festival - MERRIWA Golden Highway between Marquet St AND Dutton St
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place on Saturday for the Merriwa Festival of the Fleeces ‘Running of the Sheep’ parade being held from 7am to 3pm.

The Golden Hwy will be closed between Dutton St and Marquet St from 6am to 5pm.

Motorists will be detoured around the highway closure via Marquet St, Blaxland St and Dutton St.

Motorists travelling through Merriwa over the long weekend should allow extra travel time and expect delays.

properties.headline: NRL - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Broncos at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 7:50pm and full-time approx. 9:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Police Operation - DEE WHY St David Ave between Pittwater Road AND Fisher Road
properties.publicTransport: Route buses and school route services will be diverting around the closure. Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for more info.
properties.otherAdvice:
St David Ave will be closed between Pittwater Rd and Fisher Rd from 3.30pm to 4.15pm for a Police Operation march. Traffic will be detoured via local roads.

Delays are expected on Pittwater Rd and surrounding local roads, allow plenty of extra travel time and follow the directions of Police on site.
